commit message: lib: update robotium test lib from 5.3.1 to 5.5.1
lib: update guava lib from 16.0.1 to 18.0
misc: add tags file to gitignore
tools: add script that converts CSV translations file to Android XML files
clean: remove binary from repo
translation: convert help (FR) to reStructuredText
doc: update README
misc: migrate project to Android Studio / gradle
misc: fix typo
misc: ignore gradle/gradlew/gradlew.bat directory/files
misc: fix typo in log message
misc: fix hgdev.ch resources URIs
calc: make Measure serializable
calc: fix axis implantation measure fragment instanciation
calc: calc: fix free station measure fragment instanciation
calc: fix surface calculation fragment instantiation error

build: remove android version from manifest.xml

It is now handled in 'build.gradle'.
deps: update google guava 18.0 => 19.0
deps: update robotium library 5.5.1 => 5.5.4
misc: use material theme for API 21+ devices
misc: add OIT-Vaud as sponsor in welcome screen
doc: add meta information to rst file for help
doc: fix help (FR) with regard to tangent definition (fix #728)
jobs: some correctness fixes in import dialog
misc: various cleanups

build: revert target version from 23 to 22 due to permission issues

Android 6.0+ requires to handle permissions at runtime. Until this is
done, target older API.
misc: update VD/OIT logo
doc: generate help from rst file and add instructions
abriss: fix issue with measure angles crossing 400 grad (close #625)
axis impl: fix text in result activity
axis impl.: fix spinner and textview height issues (close #709)
axis impl: restore list of measures on orientation change (close #740)
viewUtils: handle scientific notation for readDouble (fix #712)
abriss: add more tests for issue #625
pol.survey: fix default zen. angle value when editing (close #636)
tests: pad decimal formats with 0s
calc/freest.: fix results for when compute() is called > 1x (close #731)

calc. factory: improve import error message

The message itself is pretty much useless if we do not know which
calculation raises the execption when imported.

tests: fix/improve robotium tests for slider menu

With the new material theme, there is no application title on the main
bar on which the user can click to open the drawer. Click on the first
image button instead to open the drawer.

While there, stop hard-coding menu items and use strings from resources.

calc: check input when deserializing (fix #721)

Throw a new CalculationSerializationException if appropriate. This
exception can be caught by the calculation factory when importing
calculations.
Note that this kind of check shall be generalized to all calculations.
bump version to 1.0.5
